benchmark_details.name: Evaluating Large Language Models with Grid-Based Game Competitions: An Extensible LLM Benchmark and Leaderboard
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark introduces a novel and extensible evaluation framework for large language models (LLMs) using grid-based games like Tic-Tac-Toe, Connect Four, and Gomoku, assessing capabilities such as rule comprehension and strategic thinking across diverse prompt types.
benchmark_details.data_type: game results and match data in JSON, CSV, TXT, and PNG formats

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a framework for evaluating LLMs through dynamic and competitive game scenarios, enhancing understanding of their decision-making and strategic thinking capabilities.

data.source: Simulated matches among leading LLMs and random players using a web-based game simulation application.
data.annotation: Automated recording of match data during simulated games.

methodology.calculation: Percentage of wins, draws, and disqualifications computed post-simulation to gauge model performance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher win rates and lower disqualification rates indicate better strategic and rule comprehension by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance of LLMs compared against a random play generator.
methodology.validation: Results from multiple matches were aggregated to form a leaderboard.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open-source under appropriate licenses, detailed in GitHub repository.
